text: Lithuania are scheduled to compete in the 2020 Summer Paralympics in Tokyo, Japan. ==Athletics== Lithuania have qualified one female athlete in the Games after finishing in the top four at the World Para Athletics Marathon Championships in London. {|class=wikitable |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |Aušra Garunkšnytė |Women's marathon T12 |colspan=4 | | |} ==Goalball== Lithuania's men's goalball team have qualified in the 2019 IBSA Goalball Paralympic Ranking Tournament in Fort Wayne. ==See also== *Lithuania at the Paralympics *Lithuania at the 2020 Summer Olympics ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Paralympics Category:Lithuania at the Paralympics Category:2020 in Lithuanian sport
title: Lithuania at the 2020 Summer Paralympics
